What happens if the Max-Age Option is not present in a cacheable response?
a: The response shall not be considered fresh after its age is greater than 60 seconds.

q: How does a CoAP server prevent or disable caching?
a: By setting the Max-Age Option value to 0 (zero)

q: What is the value for the Max-Age Option to prevent caching?
What happens when a CoAP client makes a new request matching a stored response?
a: The new response invalidates the old response.

q: How does a CoAP endpoint with stored responses handle subsequent requests if it cannot satisfy them?
a: It uses the Etag Option to perform a conditional request to the CoAP server where the resource is hosted.

How are multiple blocks of information transferred in oneM2M?
What are the roles of AE and CSE when binding oneM2M primitives to CoAP messages?
a: AE hosts a CoAP client and should host a CoAP server; CSE hosts both a CoAP client and a CoAP server.

q: How is oneM2M request primitive mapped to CoAP messages?
a: Single oneM2M request primitive is mapped to single CoAP request message, or multiple CoAP request messages when using block-wise transfers.

q: How is oneM2M response primitive mapped to CoAP messages?
a: Single oneM2M response primitive is mapped to single CoAP response message, or multiple CoAP response messages when using block-wise transfers.

q: When is the mapping between CoAP message and oneM2M primitive applied?
a: When the Originator sends a request primitive, or when the Receiver receives a CoAP message(s).

q: When is the mapping between CoAP message and oneM2M primitive applied?
a: In the following cases: when the Originator sends a request primitive, when the Receiver receives a CoAP message(s), when the Receiver sends a response primitive, when the Originator receives a CoAP message(s).

q: What is mapped to a corresponding CoAP message field?
a: oneM2M primitive parameter defined in oneM2M TS-0004 [2]

q: What is the purpose of this clause?
a: This clause describes where to map oneM2M parameters in a primitive to header, Option and payload fields in a CoAP message.

What type of CoAP messaging model applies to all message exchanges?
a: The CoAP messaging model defined in [1]

q: How should oneM2M requests be sent?
a: As CoAP Confirmable (CON) messages, although an Originator can send a request as a Non-confirmable (NON) message if there is a good reason for doing this.

q: What type of message should be used by an Originator that relies on getting a response to its request?
a: A Confirmable rather than a Non-confirmable message

q: How should oneM2M responses be sent?
a: As CoAP CON messages, although there is one case where a NON message should be used.

q: What type of CoAP message should be used for oneM2M Responses?
What happens if the Originator or Receiver does not receive a CoAP acknowledgement message?
a: The Originator or Receiver shall retransmit that message

q: What happens to a CoAP message that contains a oneM2M request or response, even if it was sent as Non-confirmable?
a: The recipient shall process the oneM2M request or response

q: What is the HTTP version supported by oneM2M?
What is the Response Type parameter configured as in the blocking case?
What are the options for the Receiver to send the oneM2M response?
a: Piggyback on the CoAP ACK message or send as a separate CoAP Confirmable message after sending the CoAP ACK

q: What is the type of oneM2M response when the request was sent as a Non-confirmable message?
What is the type of CoAP message that the oneM2M response should be sent as?
Can a receiver send Responses as Confirmable regardless of how the Request was sent?
What is the oneM2M Response Status Code generated by the Originator's CoAP binding if it considers that it has taken too long for the CoAP response to come back from the Receiver?
What action should the Originators CoAP binding take when it generates a response primitive containing a oneM2M Response Status Code of REQUEST_TIMEOUT?
a: Ignore any response to the original request that it might receive after it has done this.

q: What is the HTTP method used for oneM2M requests in non-blocking asynchronous case?
How should the Originator send the oneM2M request to the Receiver in non-blocking asynchronous case?
What are the possible ways a Receiver can return a response to the originator?
a: Piggybacking on CoAP ACK message or sending as a separate CoAP response message

q: When sending a response as a separate CoAP response message, what type of message should it be?
What is the oneM2M Response Status Code for nonBlockingRequestAsynch?
What should be included in the response when the Receiver supports the <request> resource type?
a: URI of the new <request> resource in a sequence of one or more Location-Path and/or Location-Query Options

q: What CoAP response code does the Receiver respond with if it doesn't support the <request> resource type?
What is the oneM2M Response Status Code for a non-blocking request in an asynchronous case?
Which CoAP method does the Receiver use to send a new message after successful processing of the request?
What is contained in the content of the oneM2M NOTIFY primitive sent by the Receiver?
What is the HTTP method used in the non-blocking synchronous case?
How should the oneM2M request be sent to the Receiver (CoAP server) in the non-blocking synchronous case?
How should the Receiver return a oneM2M response to the originator?
a: Either piggybacked on the CoAP ACK message or as a separate CoAP response message

How does a Transit CSE act when receiving a retrieve request?
a: As both CoAP client and CoAP server

q: What is the HTTP method used for oneM2M requests when 'flex blocking' is configured?
How should the Originator send the oneM2M request to the Receiver when 'flex blocking' is configured?
What is the value for disabling CoAP caching?
How to use cached information in CoAP caching mechanism by freshness?
a: Set Max-Age Option value to another value (such as the default value)

q: What is the effect of setting Max-Age option value to 0 on oneM2M mapping?
How does a new request from oneM2M layer get cached information in CoAP caching mechanism by freshness?
a: From CoAP client, not from CoAP server

q: What is the effect of presenting Etag in responses on CoAP caching mechanism by validity?
What is the condition for a CoAP endpoint to support caching mechanism?
a: If the CoAP end point supports caching mechanism by validity

q: How does a CoAP server handle Etag in responses when caching is supported?
a: The CoAP server shall not present Etag in responses to disable caching.

q: What happens if the CoAP server presents Etag in responses for caching?
a: The new request from oneM2M layer can get the stored fresh response from CoAP server, not from oneM2M layer.

q: What is the purpose of using Block Options in oneM2M?
a: To fragment and reassemble large resource representations independently of lower layers and above application.

q: Which CoAP Option defines the size of blocks used for oneM2M request primitives?
Which CoAP Option defines the size of blocks used for oneM2M response responses?
What is used for securing CoAP communication?
How are all CoAP messages sent over DTLS?
What is required for matching an ACK or RST to a CON message or a RST to a NON message in DTLS?
a: The same DTLS session and epoch

q: What is required for matching a response to a request in DTLS?
a: The same DTLS session and epoch

q: How are responses to DTLS secured requests handled?
a: Always DTLS secured using the same security session and epoch
